arts.ttl: Amorim's 'NONSENSE' Man Utd decision blasted ahead of Man City derby
arts.sum: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim has come under fire for his 'nonsense' decision to stick with Altay Bayindir over new signing Senne Lammens for their clash against Manchester City . Amorim's decision to protect Lammens from the heightened pressure of a Manchester derby has been met with bewilderment by ex-Netherlands international Johan Boskamp.

arts.ttl: Analysis: Where Man City v Man Utd will be won and lost
arts.sum: Although you would expect Guardiola to name Donnarumma in his derby XI, Amorim confirmed on Friday that Altay Bayindir, who has started all three of Man Utd's Premier League matches this season, will get the nod ahead of new signing Lammens. Pep Guardiola and Ruben Amorim both invested in new goalkeepers before the transfer window closed, and even though Man Utd's recent recruit, Senne Lammens, must wait for his first start, we will still see derby debutants in goal at both ends of the pitch.
